contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox royalty |name = Masenate Mohato Seeiso |succession = [[Queen Consort]] [[Lesotho|of Lesotho]] |image = Queen 'Masenate Mohato Seeiso.jpg |caption = |reign = 18 February 2000 - present |coronation = |predecessor = |spouse = [[Letsie III of Lesotho]] |issue = [[Lerotholi Seeiso]] |house = House of Moshesh |father = |mother = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1976|06|02|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Mapoteng]], [[Berea District]] |death_date = |death_place = |buried = }} '''Queen 'Masenate Mohato Seeiso''' (born June 2, 1976) is the [[Queen Consort]] of King [[Letsie III of Lesotho]]. {{Royal Family of Lesotho}} She was born as '''Anna Karabo Mots'oeneng''' in [[Mapoteng]] in the [[Berea District]] the eldest child of Thekiso Mots'oeneng and his wife 'Makarabo. In 1990 Queen 'Masenate enrolled at the Machabeng International College in [[Maseru]] and studied there until 1996. In 1997 she attended the [[National University of Lesotho]] and graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree.<ref>[http://www.lesotho.gov.ls/king/queen.php Her Majesty Queen'Masenate Mohato Seeiso]</ref> == Marriage == In October 1999, two years into her studies, she became engaged to King [[Letsie III of Lesotho]]. They were married on February 18, 2000 in the Lesotho Capital of Maseru.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/647779.stm Lesotho's batchelor king weds]</ref> The marriage was the first time in the history of modern Lesotho where a royal had married a [[commoner]].<ref>[http://www.worldreport-ind.com/lesotho/harmony.htm A union symbolising national harmony]</ref> Queen 'Masenate and King Letsie have three children. *[[Princess Senate Seeiso|Princess Senate]] (b. 7 October 2001) *Princess ‘Maseeiso (b. 20 November 2004) *[[Prince Lerotholi Seeiso|Prince Lerotholi]] (b. 18 April 2007) {{Infobox Monarch styles |royal name = Queen 'Masenate Mohato Seeiso of Lesotho |image = [[Image:Coats of arms of Lesotho.svg|70px]] |dipstyle = [[Majesty|Her Majesty]] |offstyle = Your Majesty |altstyle = ''Ma'am''}} ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-vac|last=[['Mamohato of Lesotho|'Mamohato]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Queen Consort]] of [[Lesotho]]|years=2000–Present}} {{s-inc|heir=}} {{end}} {{Current consorts of sovereigns}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Masenate Mohato Seeiso | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = June 2, 1976 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Mapoteng]], [[Berea District]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Masenate Mohato Seeiso}} [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Queens consort]] [[Category:People of the National University of Lesotho]] [[Category:Lesotho royalty]] [[Category:House of Moshesh]] {{Women's-History-stub}}
